title: Password Risk Meter
research_info: This website, designed as part of the research project APAMCiber (Attribution and Prevention of Threats with Impact on Multiple Relevant Groups in Cybersecurity), directed by Lorena Gonz√°lez Manzano (lgmanzan@inf.uc3m.es), funded by INCIBE and conducted at Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, aims to validate the password risk meter developed for the project. No personal data is collected.
risk_of_data_exposure: Risk of Data Exposure ?
tooltip_risk_of_data_exposure: The risk of your private data being leaked on the internet
user_login_protection: User Login Protection ?
tooltip_user_login_protection: The protection provided by the service
user_choices: User's Choices ?
tooltip_user_choices: The security that your password will have against an attack
chosen_password_uses: Number of different services in which you use this password
password_policy_violation: Invalid password. Check user login protection
suggestionScore0: Your password is too weak. Use a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols. Avoid common words.
suggestionScore1: Your password is weak. Consider adding more characters and making it less predictable.
suggestionScore2: Your password is decent, but adding length and special characters can improve security.
suggestionScore3: Good password! However, using a passphrase or adding more randomness would enhance security.
suggestionScore4: Great password! You are following best security practices.
data_privacy_notice: All data entered by the user is processed locally and no data is collected or stored.
popup_description: Follow these steps to assess your risk:
popup_step1: Select a service: Search for the service in the search bar.
popup_step2: Enter password: Type your password to evaluate its strength.
popup_step3: Enter number of uses: Specify how many times you use this password.
popup_step4: Check obtained risks: Review the risk analysis results.
reopen_instructions: You can change the language and reopen this instructions at the top right.
